area_name: G: The Wall of Wild Things

climbs.name: Welcome to the Glitter Side
climbs.fa: Molly Gabel, Dave Hug, Eric Ulner, Doug Rothe

content.description: Crawl over the hanging bloc section and balance into a layback, stick it out and balance your way to the anchor
content.location: Begins at the same spot as The Luna Moth

climbs.name: Sleeping Indian
climbs.fa: Molly Gabel, Robert McKenny, Dave Hug

content.description: Another great climb found by Ryan Richardson. Begin in the crack and work your way up to the first bolt. From here work you way to the right and side pull against a crack to eventually an undercling to stand up and work you way towards the top.
content.location: Right around the corner (to the left of) from the other routes

climbs.name: Reptilia
climbs.fa: Mackenzie Wilder, Dave Hug, Eric Ulner

content.description:
For the very large lizard that appeared during bolting 

  Begin at the same spot as Cricket Crack and make your way up and left. Pull through the face and gain access to the anchor
content.location: First sport route to the left of Cricket Crack

content.description: Climb the wide crack directly left of Sleeping Indian
content.location: First crack to the left of Sleeping Indian

climbs.name: The Luna Moth
climbs.fa: Molly Gabel, Dave Hug, Eric Ulner, Doug Rothe

content.description: Scramble over the section of hanging bloc and clip the bolt. Head and through the right wing of the Luna Moth and reach the anchor
content.location: First sport route to the left of Reptilia

climbs.name: Cricket Crack
climbs.fa: Molly Gabel, Dave Hug, Eric Ulner

content.description: Climb the crack jamming and laying back when you can. Bolted anchor at the top
content.location: The seam that separates the Tombstone from Scout's Wall

pathTokens: G: The Wall of Wild Things

content.description: The easiest wall in the park, enjoy these easy warm ups
